references.paper_title: On truthful mechanisms for maximin share allocations
references.reason: This paper lays the groundwork for truthful mechanisms in fair allocation, a core concept in the current paper's approach to fair and optimal auction design.
This paper's exploration of envy-freeness, a fairness concept, provides context for the current work's focus on proportional fairness as a different, potentially more practical measure.
This paper directly addresses auction mechanisms with fairness constraints, providing a direct link to the current paper's topic by examining subsidies and set-asides for fairness.
This paper's exploration of different notions of fair shares expands on the idea of fairness relevant to the topic of the current paper, motivating further exploration of alternate fairness notions.

references.paper_title: Mechanism design for fair division: allocating divisible items without payments
references.reason: This paper directly explores fairness in mechanism design for allocating divisible items, offering valuable insights that may be applicable to the current paper's approach to indivisible items.
